meanings.definition: In a persistent or annoying manner
meanings.sent1: She kept asking naggingly if we could go to the park again.
meanings.sent2: He would always check his phone naggingly during class.
meanings.sent3: The alarm clock beeped naggingly until she finally woke up.
meanings.sent4: The dripping faucet naggingly reminded him of the need for repairs.
meanings.sent5: The wind howled naggingly outside, making it hard to sleep.

meanings.definition: Causing annoyance or irritation by constant complaining or scolding
meanings.sent1: Her naggingly critical remarks made everyone uncomfortable.
meanings.sent2: The naggingly persistent customer demanded to speak to the manager.
meanings.sent3: The naggingly loud parrot mimicked every sound in the house.
meanings.sent4: The naggingly cold weather made it difficult to enjoy the outdoor event.
meanings.sent5: His naggingly repetitive complaints about the food were tiresome to listen to.
